description:
My favorite sandwich in the city! I've had roxies and genes and lous but this is forever my favorite.

I always get the hot pastrami with everything (incl. the obviously amazing secret sauce). I sometimes get the largest size and spread it over two meals. 

My family also agrees it's their favorite sandwich spot in the city. They close fairly early (7pm) so it's not a dinner spot but sometimes I rush over around 6:45pm to bring this home and eat for dinner.
author: Sophia L.

description:
1.5 stars
Low quality pre sliced deli meats
Incredibly bland tuna
Only one bread
It was barely a notch above subway quality
On top of that it's pricey
author: Captain B.

description:
This place is a necessity for game day! Used to stop by for lunch prior to heading over to Candlestick for the 49ers game. Now that they moved, I have a little further of a commute. Place is fully decorated with sport artifacts from signed jerseys to autographed photos of players.

I describe their turkey sandwich as the Mona Lisa of sandwiches. Simple yet elegant. The bread that is probably made in house as described by reviewers has the perfect crunch. Turkey is thinly sliced and just melts when you bite into it. Also, comes with lettuce, tomatoes, onions and mayo. After the sandwich is toasted, they add on their house dressing, which taste like a tangy vinaigrette to complete the perfectly classic turkey sandwich.
author: Ronald M.

description:
I'm a very patient and polite person. I always pause say hello and ask how the worker is doing. I came in here because of the Yelp reviews, I was so disappointed with everything, the customer service and the food!

The workers in the front making the sandwiches and running the register, are either half asleep, underpaid or simply don't care how they treat you.  

*Note to the owners in the back of the kitchen sticking their heads out every now and then... have a meeting with your employees about customer service or simply hire new ones. I promise you, with this kind of service your reviews are going to head downhill!
author: Yuriy T.

description:
So good. One of the best sandwiches I've ever had for sure. It's a tiny place and when my husband put this place on our itinerary I thought it was a museum or something, but this is way way better. 

Tiny hole in the wall with maybe 5 tables max, most of them 2 seaters, this is not the place for a large party. We waited in line and though it took a while I realized it's because they keep it in the oven for so long that it heats up all the way through. 

We ordered a super sized pastrami sandwich with avocado with onions on half and they nailed it. The bread was super fresh, crunchy and chewy in all the right spots, the pastrami was not crazy salty and was dripping fat due to aforementioned oven time. 

Operationally it's not the best since there's basically 2 lines, the line to the left is to order your sandwich and then you get out of that line go into a second line to the right to pay and then you wait wherever you can to get your actual food. I saw quite a few people calling their sandwich in and then picking up, I recommend you do that.
author: Amy K.

description:
My boyfriend was PUMPED to come here on a recent trip to San Francisco so I was super excited to come here as well. This spot is a little hole in the wall and is currently (as of July in 2018) surrounded by construction so it's very easily missed. That said, it is worth scoping out. 

My boyfriend got the atomic and it was DELICIOUS. I got just the turkey and cheese which was also SO GOOD. I initially was skeptical because this place really was just a hole in the wall and I couldn't understand what was so special about it But it. was. delish. I'm such a fan. I'm now salivating in my living room 100 miles away just thinking about it. 

Definitely worth a stop by!
author: Hannah D.

description:
One my favorite local sandwich shops! Order the roast beef or pastrami sandwich! My go-to for a classic sandwich. They use their secret sauce which I think is just Italian dressing but adds a nice tart flavor to the sandwich. The bread is also toasted to create the perfect crunch when you bite in. 

What's nice is they offer different sandwich sizes. You can get a mini, center or super. I usually order the center which is just enough for me but if you plan on sharing for two might as well order the super. 

I recommend ordering online. There can be a long wait during lunch hours and you can save yourself some wait time. Also, parking isn't easy in the area especially now that there is MUNI construction going on by West Portal so take out is definitely best method.
author: Kristy L.

description:
A very reasonable sandwich, but nothing to write home about. There were about 3-4 people at a small counter making the sandwiches to order. They all get toasted, which is a nice touch, but it adds to the time for each sandwich. The staff moves quickly but it still took us a good 20 minutes to get our sandwiches when we were about 5th in line. Maybe because they also make the call-in orders on the same counter. 

Sandwiches were wrapped in thin wax paper which didn't the 30 minutes it took for us to get the the park. They were all soggy and fallen apart, as were the sandwiches. Highly recommend enjoying these sandwiches fresh in store, if you're going to try them at all.
author: Jenn W.

description:
First time here and was in the neighborhood so I decided to try it out since the review was high on yelp. I got super size on both sandwich roast beef and avocado ,pastrami and Swiss. I also paid extra $2 for extra meat on the pastrami which I'm not sure if he gave it to me even though I did ask him again to confirm. In addition to the sandwich I got two drinks, two chips and a whole $1.50 pickle. Total came up to be $37 dollars. 

Totally not worth it. The Sandwich for a super size is so small for the price I paid. Just check the picture of the so call extra pastrami meat sandwich. Even Louie's, Ike's, Roxie,etc. has more meat without paying extra $2 for meat. The bread didn't wow me either and everything comes with basic lettuce, onion and tomato. Honestly I should give it 2 star than 3star but the pastrami meat was pretty good with flavor. The sandwich reminds me of Safeway sandwich so it's decent you can get anywhere even a corner store. Service is nothing wow but they were busy and it is a fast food Togo place so can't expect too much. 

Anyway... would I come back? Probably not. So many other sandwiches that's so good and a few on my list of places referred by friends to try. Not sure how this place got high ratings or maybe through time it gotten worse than remain it's consistency's.
author: Christy V.

description:
Love this spot! Well made sandwiches, with simple ingredients. I usually get the hot pastrami sandwich. Their secret sauce has a vinaigrette flavor, which goes well with all the sandwiches. Prices are fair, my only complaint is they don't have different bread options (trying to watch those calories). 

Parking here can be a little difficult on a busy afternoon. You can call in ahead of time and pick up fairly quickly.
author: Lauren P.

description: Pastrami sandwich is one of the best I've ever had. And, I've only ever had it brought to me by a friend so I have never even experienced it fresh! I can only assume the rest of their subs are as good...
author: Dennis P.

description: Great spot get a sub if you're in the area, conveniently by the West Portal Muni stop. The place is a bit small, so I recommend getting your order to go. The meat and veggies are fresh, and the staff is professional and courteous. They'll give you an honest answer of what meat is great today. Great lunch spot in the West Portal area.
author: Joel G.

description:
Omg i got the veggie sandwich! 
First everything looks so fresh and seems really clean their, and the choices are amazing. They make everything seem simple to choose everything's easy to read on the menu. And they warm your sandwiches up and they're not stingy with ingredients. And there was no long wait which was great we went around 3:30 p.m. on a Thursday. I would recommend the Sandwich Spot to anybody that wants a really good nice mom and pop homemade sandwich.
author: Julie D.

description:
Yelpers led us here as were passing thru and needed lunch not too far out of the way.  If you're not familiar with the area - this street is literally a few buildings long so park on nearby street or in the lot (metered) across the way. 

It's a very small shop with a giant sign saying "gourmet sandwiches" out front. I believe there are  6 or 7 small tables inside.  This is the ONLY seating.  If when you walk in there is an open table - GRAB IT!  Or you will be eating in your car as we did. 

When we entered, the first table has an employee sitting at one of the few 4 tops with her phone and salad she brought from from home. 

We ordered the "center" or medium sized pastrami that everyone raves about and one of the "gourmet" sandwiches-  roast beef, avocado and cucumber.  The  avocado and cucumber IS the gourmet difference.  :( 

It took 10 minutes to make them, by this time a line of people came and it reaches the door.  Locals knew to grab tables and did.  The staff member continued to leisurely eat her salad and play on her phone instead of making it available to a paying customer.  Lost a star for this - poor customer service 

SANDWICH REVIEW:

Both of us agree the bread was delicious.  It's a soft center that has a nice toast crust when they warm it in the oven.  The "center" size was a decent sized sandwich equivalent to the size at Safeway.  The toasty bread makes a mess - no biggie but be prepared. 

Pastrami was well seasoned and shaved.  One side of the bread is French's plain yellow mustard. 1.5 slices of generic provolone cheese,  handful of shredded iceberg lettuce, 4 tomato slices and a big scoop of mayo on the bread.   Before closing it - the secret sauce is Italian salad dressing in a squeeze bottle which they drench the lettuce in. 

Sandwich was good - wished it had more meat and less dressing.  Defiantly made a mess while eating.  It was a decent sandwich. 

Wife has the "Gourmet Roast Beef" -
Same fixings except she has three thin slices of avocado and cucumber - which they forgot or didn't have because it wasn't there. It was good - not gourmet and the Italian dressing was a bit much. 

2 sandwiches and a small soda $22.

Overall,  would we come back?  If we were in the area and didn't want to try and find something else - then yes.   Would get the pastrami and go light on dressing.  Wife would do turkey or something else. 

It's better than Safeway because of the bread.  But if you've had Ike's or mikes sourdough - they are better.
author: marc j.

description:
My friend and I were visiting San Francisco for the day & by lunch time, we had decided we were down for sandwiches. Having seen so many good reviews on Yelp, we decided to give it a try. 

Now this could be totally my fault since I'm an out-of-towner and don't know what's good here..but I ordered the sausage meatball marinara (or something along the lines of that), and it was just absolutely gross. I really didn't want to finish because I genuinely was not enjoying it, but the Filipino in me forced me to. And I was so sad because I so wanted a good sandwich. My friend also did not enjoy her sandwich. 

I know they must have some good stuff because the line was out the door, but unfortunately, I just didn't personally experience that.
author: Sabine W.

description:
Fresh..

This place make a ice sandwich, nicely toasted bread, good fresh vegetables, as well as the meat being of good quality..
author: Head Chef F.

description:
Last month would mark the 1st time revisiting this sandwich shop in 15 years and about 30 years since my sister had been here.  My sister was in town and we happened to be in our old childhood neighborhood of west portal.  Of course we've gotta stop at the nostalgic submarine sandwich shop our mom used to take us to after getting off the Muni. The place looks almost identical inside as it did when we were kids with that huge wooden menu and the bread on the wall.
  We were pretty excited to see that the deli had a 4.5 avg on yelp after all these years and that our memories did not deceive us of what we thought a good sandwich tasted like from when we were kids.  It must the the combination of the crusty bread, yellow mustard, fresh chopped lettuce and their special sauce that set them apart.  The sauce isn't your typical oil and vinegar, theres a little something extra in it, mustard? Herbs? Idk.
  We ordered the turkey and pastrami 7" sandwich as a snack, as there were many food destinations that weekend. The flavors brought us back to when we were lil kids, and i'd swear one of the guys still works there from back in the day.  Would still highly recommend this little family owned sub shop.
author: Spencer W.

description:
I ordered my sandwiches on line and was in a rush to pick it up  expecting it would be ready on a busy Sunday afternoon. First I was told that someone already picked up my order but then I was told they missed my order and yet they already charged me on my credit. I ended up waiting for another  20 mins!!!
At the same time, a walk in customer who spoke Spanish got her order made right away!?! 
I would never go back there after being treated as a second class customer!!
author: Yvonne L.

description:
Subcenter is our go to. Always delicious and never fails. I usually order the pastrami, everything, with extra sauce. You won't be disappointed!

Also, Gene's on Taraval - same same. They're cousins.
author: L F.

description: This place is a neighborhood classic. Been coming here since I was little and have slowly moved down the menu to try most of the sandwiches. The hot pastrami with everything is my favorite with added cucumbers for a little crunch. Make sure to call it in 15 mins before during lunch as it can get packed !
author: Drew F.

description: When I come to West Portal, I keep it simple and solid with a slice at Goat Hill Pizza or sandwich at Submarine Center. $8 and change for a mini sandwich and bag of maui onion chips. Perfectly toasted French bread and love the tangy secret sauce dressing.
author: Rhea A.

description:
Submarine Center is by far one of the best sandwich places in the Bay Area. I can personally say it is in my personal list of top 3 sandwich shops in San Francisco in general! If you don't agree with me then you will have to go there and see how busy it is! The sandwiches are absolutely fresh, warm, and everything just melts in your mouth instantly. I highly recommend their hot pastrami sandwich, turkey avocado, and meatball sub. Those three are seriously what gets customers coming back every time. The biggest deciding factor is their special sauce. It is some kind of italian dressing blend I believe but holy moly is it good. 

This shop is no hassle to get to. There is plenty of parking in the residential areas near that place, and you are next to the West Portal station. 

When you walk in, you see a lot of sports memorabilia, especially 49ers gear.
author: John M.

description:
With so many great reviews and being a big fan of sandwiches I had been wanting to check out Submarine Center for quite some time since it's close to my sons school.  Today was finally the day and I was not disappointed.  My wife had the turkey avocado and I had an Italian.  The bread was crunchy but not hard on the outside but soft on the inside (a hard feat to achieve).  The meats were good but the special sauce definitely made the meal.

Good local spot with quality sandwiches.
author: Blake B.

description:
Yummy, inexpensive sandwich (considering you can't find a deli sandwich for less than $13 these days). A bit confusing for a first timer: you stand in one line to order and then stand in a second line to pay and receive your food, not in the order of who came first but just who's sandwich happens to be ready first. It's a bit disorganized, but that didn't take away from the experience.

Tip: you can call ahead and pick up your sandwich, skipping both lines.
author: Adriana G.

description:
This place has been there for years and is VERY popular.
Do yourself a favor and call ahead to order.
You walk in, pay and eat while others stand in line.
Also, the sandwiches are huge. If you're used to Subway, 
order a smaller size and it will probably be enough.
author: Mark S.

description:
These sandwiches are epic. Some of the best in town. So good--so consistently good. Worth the drive, worth occasionally having to look for parking, worth the madness of the line/crowd situation near the counter. The sandwiches are where it's at.

My only comment would be to make pickles a standard condiment for their sandwiches. It is not--but you can add it by request.

Still, a small gripe for an amazing sandwich shop and San Francisco institution.

Also--there is a great bar next door--the Philosopher's Club. If ever you want a refuge from the restaurant--take your sandwich there. They do not mind--and... beer!
author: Mitch H.

description: Delicious sandwiches! Simplicity is key. Family owned and never settles for food below standards
author: Manny R.

description:
Really good straightforward delicious sandwiches, love the fact they have three different sizes to choose from. Since my wife is vegan I'm always looking for places that have options and they have a vegetarian sandwich which my wife also liked. 
Just like many sandwich places, they have a secret sauce which is really good.
author: Elmer I.

description: The sandwiches here are consistently good and the service is always friendly.   I usually order their super turkey, no mustard with cheese and share it with my boy or someone else because it's a pretty generous size.  If you're short on time, you can always call your order ahead and they'll have your order ready within 10 to 15 minutes (depending on # of sandwiches of course).  I love their maui onion chips as well and always grab a bag or two with my sandwich.  I'm here often and highly recommend then.
author: Christine P.

description: I love this place.  Been going here for nearly 30 years and the pastrami sandwich is still the best thing in the universe.  It's on a list of last meals for sure. Oh my god. I want to eat it right now.
author: Derek H.

description:
This place has been around forever and never disappoints. The sandwiches are fresh and all the guys make them so fast.
My fav is the italiano but you cannot go wrong with any of the selections.
The place is always crowded, which is a testament to the quality and taste that appeals to everyone at any time of day.
Thanks for being here and being a San Francisco favorite.
author: Wilson L.

description:
Best subs in town, IF you can get them to take your order. :(
They apparently do the bulk of their business through online orders. I just stood in front of the counter and at least 5 employees for 10 minutes, and nobody would take my order. Horrible system, if any, which sucks because the subs are great. Hopefully I'll get to taste again someday.
author: Jon C.

description:
Came here Friday for lunch with co-workers. We ordered using Yelp's Eat24 service so when we arrived at 12:10pm, we just needed to walk to the right side of the sandwich shop to pick up orders. I like that there are two lines - one line for ordering (left side) and the other line for order pick ups. Submarine Center is right next to the West Portal metro station so it makes commuting here from work easy! The sandwich shop is not that huge (several tables), but the walls are aligned with sports memorabilia from the 49ers to the Giants and even the Warriors. Very cool to see if you're a sports fanatic.

For the sandwiches, they come in 3 sizes - Mini ($6.20), Center ($7.70), and Super ($9.75). If you can eat a lot, the Super is the one for you. I ordered the Super for my Meatball Sub and after finishing, I was bloated. I think the Center would have satisfied my hunger and I would have been content with the Center. All sandwiches come with mustard, mayo, onions, lettuce, tomatoes, and their secret sauce. We brought back the sandwiches to work to eat (10-15 mins) and it does have a decent weight to it. However my bread for the meatball sub was a bit burnt on top, but nothing too bad - still edible! My meatball sub was drenched with red sauce which is good, but it didn't seem to pair well with the mustard and onions. Also the meatballs were a bit bland in flavor - it simply tasted like the red sauce. I'd prefer the meatballs to be more seasoned and more flavorful. I would add cheese (extra money) to the sandwich if you're thinking of ordering a meatball sub. Otherwise I think I'd order a different sandwich here. I remember ordering the Hot Pastrami Sub (Super) the previous time I came here and that sandwich definitely tasted better and was not burnt at all. I also wish this sandwich shop had Dutch Crunch as an option for bread.

Overall a decent price value for what you get. The Super is pretty good size for the sandwiches and you don't need to wait long if you order ahead. Plus with the walls filled with sports memorabilia, this sandwich shop is pretty cool. I'd come back again and try a different sandwich.
author: Alvin Y.

description: The best sandwich you will ever have in your life. Like last meal good. I dream about these things.
author: Devon M.

description: Thank you Yelpers for another great find.  I was in the neighborhood and needed lunch, turned to yelp, and you all led me to the perfect spot. I got the super size pastrami with everything except mayonnaise and a half of a pickle. Yummy yummy the best sandwich ever....the bread is crisp outside and tender on the inside.  I took the other half of the sandwich home to San Diego and my son finished it 4 hours later.  He loves it. Great Sammy.
author: t d.

description:
Submarine Center is a wonderful little sandwich shop in the West Portal area for some simple, well-made submarine sandwiches!

I came here with two friends on a Saturday afternoon to grab lunch before a long expedition walk through the city. I opted for a center size of their G4 sandwich which comes with avocado, pastrami, and swiss cheese. It was a delightful sandwich with a perfectly crisp, yet soft bread. There was a generous amount of pastrami and avocado for the price to make for a delicious moment with every bite.

Whether you're looking to get a box full of giant submarine sandwiches for a party, a simple and wonderful lunch with friends or family, or for some sandwiches to grab and go for a picnic or time at the beach, Submarine Center is the place to go!
author: Joshua M.

description:
This is my first time going to the sandwich shop and when I first got in there, I had to explore the menu since the way you order and what you can't order is slightly different than your typical subway or similar. Here at submarine center they have three sizes. They have a mini, center and a large or a full, I'm not sure what it was called.

Once you decide on your size, and the type of sandwich that you want you can order it in any with any of the available sandwich makers. They're all very friendly and polite. Today I opted for the corn beef sandwich.

I originally thought that I saw Dutch crunch bread in pics, but when I did not see any bread options I felt disappointed.

They make the sandwich quickly then pop it in the oven for about a minute and ring you up toward the end. When I got my sandwich I had to go and eat it in the car, and within the first bite of my sandwich I was surprised with the amazing crunch. Despite them not having Dutch crunch, this definitely had a crunch which beat out many other Dutch crunch bread that I have had. The flavor was great!

The sandwich was not too heavy and overall it was amazing. With their quick service, they're friendly attitude and an amazing sandwich, I will definitely be coming back for more. Up next on my list will be there pastrami since it looked amazing.
author: Masa K.

description:
A sandwich spot that's straightforward and to the point.

It's a good filler for a meal that doesn't get you to food coma.

Simple menu and selections.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Best pastrami sandwich i've had in SF since moving over here. Its a walk from my house so i'll forsure be going here more often to try their other seections, good prices too, easily a local favorite.
author: Alex D.

description: This place is fire. Atomic, pastrami, and italiano sandwiches are all A1. Cheesesteak is aight too. Meat and veg are always fresh. I just moved to Miraloma and now i'm pretty much a regular at this joint. Fire subs. Highly recommended.
author: K M.

description: This place is a gem! There menu is huge with so many great options it's hard to even decide what to get it. Can't wait to go back!
author: Kim P.

description: I honestly don't come here enough but I should. And I contemplated whether or not I should leave a 5 star review because the lines will only grow longer. But... who am I kidding! It's not like it's a secret anymore! Hot pastrami sandwich is hands down THE best sandwich that will ever grace your mouth. Totally inhaled a center sized sub within minutes. Thinly sliced, melt in your mouth meat but very generous with portions. Bread is SO FLUFF with just the right toasty crunchiness. You know how sometimes you eat something so good, and you want to go slow to savor each bite but you can't stop, and then suddenly you get a bit sad as you're approaching the last bite? This sandwich makes me get those feels every time. If I had room for seconds, I would.
author: Nadeen H.

description: The Italian sub is perfection. I don't have the courage to try anything else but I'm sure they're great.
author: Armen T.

description: This place is hands down my favorite sub place. How these guys coordinate making these sandwiches in such a tight space is insane. Pretty expensive but me and my boyfriend treat ourselves every once in awhile when we can. The turkey/pastrami sub with avocado is SO GOOD. C'mon payday....
author: Tanya T.

description: This place has amazing food. It's fast and very delicious. While it's a small place we where still able to fit a stroller in and eat in comfort. Parking is across the street... don't park in the gas station . I tried but the sign will direct you otherwise. The staff was quick. All you see is food moving and orders going out. Highly recommend.
author: Chris D.

description: Busy little place.  Food seems pretty good overall, fresh, and the bread was bomb but they royally screwed up my order of two sandwiches. They forget MULTIPLE things on the sandwhiches,  then put on things I specifically told them not to which made the sandwhiches not so good‍ I don't know if I will be back.  It's like they just made them they way they had on the menu and disregarded what I said.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
THIS PLACE RULES! I have been coming here for the last 5 years and always take friends visiting from out of town. It always makes me laugh how this is the only restaurant they miss from SF.

I HIGHLY recommend the Hot Pastrami Sandwich! I order it with everything on it including cheese and add extra tomatoes!

Just writing this review makes me want to go back again tonight!
author: Ryanbradley N.

description:
These guys are the best. They have been making amazing sandwiches for over 30 years- that's how long I have been a customer.
I always make it a point to say hello and get a hot pastrami (hold the onion), when I'm in the city visiting my folks & old friends. 
Keep it simple and call it in. Grab and go. 
Not many of these old school San Franciscan ma &pa businesses left!
See you there!
author: Walt C.

description:
Craving a sandwich, which is unusual for me, so I turned to Yelp. I was looking for a sub in particular, good meat, shredded lettuce (a must), soft bread, and a tasty vinegary sauce....Well Sub Center caught my eye, and after reading the reviews and looking at all the pics, I was hooked. It was a rainy Saturday afternoon, and I ventured out to West Portal. Snagged a parking in front, (sometimes I just get lucky). There were only a few customers there when I arrived, but that soon changed.
I could not decide, so I chose the Atomic, a little bit of the best....Corned Beef, Hot Pastrami, Turkey, jalapenos, oh and cheese, a must. He toasted it to perfection, then mustard, mayo, lettuce, onions and that delightful drizzle. No tomatoes, not a fan. By the time I paid and was ready to go, the place was filling up! Everyone greeting each other, obviously family owned and serving a happy community. I made my way back to Pacifica where I enjoyed my perfectly prepared sammy. It was exactly what I wanted, and it really hit the spot. 
As I said, I don't often get a craving for a sandwich, and I have had my share, however, this place is the real deal, out of my way but totally worth it!!!
author: D. K.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet! I've been coming here for 20 years. I'm not even all that old! There's something special about their magical pastrami, fresh veggies, and whatever dressing they add onto the fresh lettuce. I usually get the Turkey, Pastrami, and Swiss. The Pastrami, swiss, and avocado is also really really good! 

What they do is add on your meat and cheese onto the bread, put it into the salamander for toasting, then add on the rest of your toppings and the dressing, cut it in half, and serve it up! Grab yourself an Orangina or Martinelli's and you're set to have one amazing meal! It's pretty small in there, so hop in line and pay attention. Those guys are quick! There's basically one line to place your order and another line to pay. 

This is one of my favorite sandwich spots in SF. Easily. They don't even serve dutch crunch and it's still worthy of 5 stars!
author: Aaron Y.

description: This is my favorite place to get a sandwich in the country!   We get the Super Atomic. Yum!!!! There are a bunch of other sandwiches we want to try because I'm sure they're also amazing but we get the same thing each time. Thanks, Sub Center. We love you.
author: Rikki M.

description:
You know how easy it is to make a sandwich at home? Pretty damn easy and cheaper than quite literally anywhere else you'd pay for someone to make it for you. 

But, I bet it wouldn't be as delicious as Submarine Center would make it. The Atomic was awesome! Tons of delicious meat, tons of delicious toppings and it was perfectly toasted. It was so big, I had to go straight Guy Fieri on it; in a slightly bent over position, firm grip on the sandwich with both hands, 3 deep controlled breaths in order to gain a steely look of determination and focus m in my eyes and my mouth open like a python trying to eat an alligator. Yeah, that actually happens a lot in FL and yes, it has literally nothing to do with this review other than to be used as a perfect metaphor. 

I also thought it was a great value for the money. 

My pastrami (the word beef is so overused) with this place was that you don't automatically get chips. My body fat says I don't technically need chips but it's a damn sandwich. It should come with that small, cheap bag of chips these guys have on that ugly shelf :)

It won't keep me from eating here if I don't feel like making a sandwich. 'Twas delicious and I shall be back! Parking was a bitch!
author: Saimir O.

description: Subcenter is my number one, go-to sandwich spot in San Francisco. I've been coming to this place ever since I was a kid and one thing is for sure, the flavor is original and has not changed ONE BIT. My top 3 items I always get: The Pizza. I cannot express how much this just tickles my soul. If you do decide to order this, make sure you ask for this first because it takes a little more time than the sandwiches. Served on the bread roll and it is DELISH! My two other items are the famous cheesesteak and pastrami. Make sure you get both sandwiches with the special sauce!
author: Daniella J.

description: I still love this place! It is my favorite sandwich shop in the city. Since being pregnant I cannot eat turkey so this will be one of the foods my sister will bring me in the hospital! No joke. YUM
author: Amanda M.

description: I have been waiting to write this review. But enough with this establishment. Sandwiches are good and convenient. However, the service is horrible. And if you notice they also never switch out their gloves going in and out of the back and the building. In my mind it is not very sanitary. Extremely rude to customers, period. The only time they would get their "act" together was when you gave them the same negative energy. Interestingly, the owner or another older family member is always watching the register at all times. So there seems to already be an extreme lack of trust. Bark at you asking you what you want and then don't remember. The attitudes of nearly all front end employees is completely unsatisfactory and after the 10th time I will never spend another dollar there.
author: DJ H.

description: As a sixth generation SF family I can tell you this is one of the best sandwich spots in the city. I've been coming here for over 23 years and you can always count on a consistently delicious sandwich. Submarine Center is like a time capsule with all the vintage sports memorabilia. You know a place is doing it right with this kind of stay power. What's particularly awesome is my kids love going here also and the ownership remembers me coming as a kid. I love, love this place.
author: Daniel D.

description: Love this "old school" sub place!!
author: Alison Finnegan E.

description:
One of my favorite sandwich spots - I wish I lived closer! 4.5 stars. You know it's good when you're willing to travel out of your way to swing by for a sammie.

I've been wanting to try the gourmet sandwiches here for a while, but I've always been about the S3 Italiano (Mortadella, Capicolla, Salami, & Provolone).

+0.5 for the options of different sizes: Mini, Center, Super. I love that!
+1 for the homey, friendly, neighborhood vibes and nice service.
+1 for the efficient sandwich assembly line system. Pretty speedy even when the line is out the door. 
+1 for the fresh and toasty bread! And I don't know if this makes sense, but I like how thin it is!
+1 for the optimum meat / filling to bread to fixings ratio. And every time I ask for extra onions, they don't forget!
author: Ashley S.

description: West Portal institution, so they don't need my review added to the glowing ones that have been up here for years.  Simple, ample sandwiches on great toasted white bread rolls.  The staff are remarkably efficient for a place that gets so crowded.  Don't be put off by long lines, but it's best to take out if you don't want to eat with people breathing on you as they wait in line to order or pick up food.
author: Mike R.

description: This place is my happy place.  I love their sandwiches so much that my fiance and I always come here to get our "Special Sandwiches".  The bread, dressing, and overall goodness makes these sandwiches Life Changing good.  And I love the family and sweet guys that work here.  Can you build one in Pacifica?
author: Sally G.

description: I've been going here since high school (so almost 20 years, wow that sounds old) and the sandos are never anything less than uh-mazing. It's a hole in the wall and there's often a line but the sandwiches are worth the wait. Plus it's next to the tunnel at West Portal which always has a cool, subterranean feel, like ninja turtles are just around the corner.
author: Kayla N.

description: My family and I live in the area so I've been going here my whole life. I usually get the same sandwich and every single time Sub Center has concocted a work of art in between two toasted buns. The selection of subs, chips, and drink will surely leave a hungry customer in disbelief and leave wondering if they will have to compare every sandwich they will have again to The Submarine Center...
author: Alex N.

description:
order the largest size
get the pastrami
put everything on it
eat it hot and fresh
take a nap after
author: Derrick W.

description:
A small local sandwich joint that makes simple, but delicious sandwiches.

My wife grew up in the neighborhood and makes it a point to stop by Sub Center every time we go visit. After having their pastrami a few times, I'm becoming a believer. There's no fancy sauces or ingredients that make these sandwiches great. Just some really good toasted bread, tender hot meats, and a good ratio of fresh ingredients, finished with some house vinaigrette. The fact that these guys have been dishing out the same quality sandwich for years is worth something in my book. Just an all around solid sandwich.
author: Jeong P.

description: Loved this place. Stopped by on our way to the airport. You tell it's a local favorite. Their quick with their service. The sandwiches are amazing. We had the G2 and S3. I would recommend to anyone. Very happy we stopped here.
author: Rebekah S.

description:
San Francisco Treat.
Must have Hot Pastrami. .
Served with mayo, mustard,  onions, lettice, tomatoes, and their own secret sauce. 
Secret Sauce takes this sandwich to the next level. Bread is fresh toasted,  veggies are fresh n crispy. 
Gotta come back
Highly recommend
author: Hungry K.

description: Always delicious and fast as lightning compared to other delis.  The hot pastrami is delish.
author: Rachael C.

description:
How do I describe my perfect sandwich? 

Toasty-but not too toasted, warm in the inside, just the right amount of veggie essentials such as lettuce, tomato, onions. Along what I think is the most important- the perfect amount of layered meat with delicious sauce to end it all but still not too saucy to make the sandwich soggy. 

What place has this perfect sandwich? WELL, that would be the Submarine Center sir/madam! 

Opened for more than a decade, the Submarine Center is a locally known hole-in-the-wall filled with amazing sandwiches. My go-to sandwich here is the Hot Pastrami. Bread is toasted to a light brown shell that makes a crunch noise every time you bite into it. While biting in, you taste the juiciness of the pastrami mixed in with lettuce, tomatoes, and onions. The secret sauce makes it all more mouth-watering. Doesn't it make you want your own? And a size 'Super' for under $10? YES...mmm.

Even a delicious place has its downsides. Like every place located in SF, parking is crazy hard and stressful to find. Also, due to the shop size, sometimes there are long lines that can form to the outside of the shop. Not to mention, its right next to West Portal station where its a hot spot for people to go to during lunch rush hours. 

Never mind the downsides though because it's all about that sandwich! Come get your delicious sandwich here if you're ever around the area! I definitely recommend it!
author: Tiffany H.

description: I was lucky enough to airbnb 6 minute walk away from this place. My boyfriend and I flew in a bit too early and had nothing to eat so we walked down to west portal and this place was the first food we've stumbled upon in San Francisco. We ordered a pastrami sub and a turkey ham lettuce tomato provolone and mayo sub and sat down and dug right in. We both exchanged a look upon our first bite.... My god...both of us were blown away by how good they were. Was it the hunger tricking us about how good this place really was? No way... We were so impressed with the quality, we came back 2 more times in our short stay. we came back the morning of our flight grabbed the same sandwiches to go and were on our way. Best airport meal I've ever had. Thank you so much for playing such a big part in our trip, submarine center. you are dearly missed!!
author: Karina S.

description: The best sub ever!!! Their sandwiches are rich in flavor and quality! I recommend this place for everybody!
author: Andrea M.

description: Got a meatball sub here, pretty good but definitely not the best. The service wasn't that great either. The only communication I had with the cashier was when he told me the price. You pretty much walk up to the front and tell one of the sandwich artists what you want and the cashier rings you up. Cool little joint steps away from the West Portal muni entrance and relatively quick. Go ahead and give them a shot, I will most likely be back to try the atomic sometime soon too!
author: Navdeep D.

description: Love this place! I've been going there for years and try to get there whenever I am in San Francisco. The Submarine and roast beef are my go-to sandwiches. I'll often get a mini of each to satisfy both cravings.
author: Patrick B.

description: The best. Period. Love the vegetarian, the meatball, the pastrami. Also like the classic subs.
author: armand d.

description: Delicious sandwiches, reasonably priced, small town family-owned business atmosphere...highly recommend!
author: Meghan L.

description: This is a goldmine for its owners, two family members watching the till at all times. Food quality just ok. Seniors get treated rudely, the owners don't care, they appreciate the fast buck from highschoolers This Place may have been around a long time but without respect for the customer it's just a matter of time. You can find much better!
author: Martin M.

description: Always delicious sandwich. Toasted bread, super flavorful, addicting. The staff are incredibly efficient for a place that gets so crowded.
author: Eden B.

description: Always delicious sandwich. Toasted bread, super flavorful, addicting. The staff are incredibly efficient for a place that gets so crowded.
author: Felicity V.

description:
In my opinion, one of the best sandwich shops in SF.

As an SF native who lived ~5 minutes away, I would frequent this shop a lot growing up.  It has remained the same over the past 20+ years with the same duo behind the counter making the sandwiches and taking orders.  This is a small shop with ~5 tables that is mainly used for take-out orders.  Sandwiches are available in three sizes, with a number of gourmet sandwiches on the menu.  There is only one bread (toasted) available, an Italian roll (white) which works perfectly for these sandwiches.  There are also pizza subs, meatball sandwiches, sausage sandwiches, and a few options aside from ordering sandwiches with typical deli meat.

I recently went by to order an atomic sandwich and a turkey sandwich.  They were both the right amount of meat, cheese, and lettuce/tomato with the crisp bread that is a great pairing.  The atomic contains three different meats (turkey, corned beef, hot pastrami) along with cheese and jalapenos.  You can taste each meat without any overpowering the others, definitely would recommend - this is also the sandwich featured in Eater SF's list of best SF sandwiches.  The turkey sandwich contains oven roasted turkey - nothing too special, but turkey has always been one of my personal favs for sandwiches.

Parking may be difficult, so I would recommend this if you manage to find parking, are waiting for MUNI in the West Portal tunnel, or have a friend to drive you over and pick up.  If you are in the West Portal/Portola area and craving a sandwich, definitely hit up Submarine Center.
author: Brian C.

description:
Submarine has been consistently a superb sandwich shop. I've lost track of the amount of times I've been here since my friend first introduced this place to me about a decade ago.

The sandwiches are all so good. My favorite is definitely the turkey, though the pastrami comes pretty close. The bread is toasted perfectly and is always so crisp and fresh. They top the sandwich with a huge portion of vegetables, drenched with a fantastic sauce. All the ingredients balance so well together. Everytime I eat the sandwich, it's almost always gone before I know it!

Highly recommended!
author: Alvin W.

description:
Growing up in a traditional Chinese family, sandwich was never my thing until my hubby introduced it to me.  It is so good and we have been going there for years.   My favorite is the atomic as you can't go wrong with turkey, pastrami & corned beef.

They get really busy during rush hours but the online order makes everything easy.  I order in advance and pick up without wait - love it!
author: C S.

description:
I ordered the turkey and Swiss...I'm eating it as I'm typing this and it's amazing. 

No joke I'm super full right now but I need to finish the other half of my sub because it's that good lol
author: Caroline S.

description:
I have been eating here for thirty five years and they have always been the best sandwiches in San Francisco. I have tried most of their sandwiches over the years, but my favorite is and always has been the roast beef with provolone. 

The hot pastrami is also off the hook but you have to eat it there on site while the lettuce and tomato are still cold; if you take it home, the "hot pastrami" combined with oven time will make the sandwich so hot that the lettuce and tomato will be warm and taste gross by the time you get it home. Other favorites include "The Submarine" (two hams, salami and cheese) The Turkey Avocado and Swiss, and "The Italiano" Mortadella, Capicolla, Salami and Provolone. 

Call ahead of time for your order and get someone behind the counters eye and wave them down with the "phone hand gesture" if you don't want to wait too long when it gets busy. It's very awkward when it's busy and some people are ordering and others are waiting for their orders. 

Parking at West Portal is a pain in the butt, but there are usually extra spots along Portola if you don't mind parallel parking on a busy avenue and walking up and down the hill on Claremont Blvd. or try the next block up Ulloa street. 

Another thing worth mentioning is that if you and a friend each want a "mini" and want the same thing, order a "super" and split it! it's like two mini's and about three or four dollars less that way. 

Whatever you get here, you'll be pleased with their delicious oven toasted sandwiches. Also, the staff are always friendly and helpful! Good guys!
author: David A.

description: This place is as good as it gets. I have been a customer for as long as I can remember and I am telling you, I would never get a sandwich from any other place. They make THE BEST sandwiches I've ever had in my life. They load up on whatever you want. The employees remember returning customers and their orders which I find very nice. They take online and phone orders as well, super helpful if you want to beat the afternoon rush! They also accept Apple Pay which is a huge plus!
author: Tara C.

description:
I've been coming here for a long time -- maybe almost 20 years.

I've had every sandwich under the sun here and my faves are turkey, pastrami or if craving lots of beef, the Atomic.

Every sandwich I've had here has been amazing.  They are perfectly toasted and best eaten hot, right on site.

I know they have salads, soups and pizzas but have never ordered anything other than their sandwiches.
author: Susan C.

description: Great sandwiches! I just got done eating the hot pastrami, I definitely recommend getting this sandwich. Simple ingredient, but the secret sauce gives it that great taste! Will be back if I'm in the area
author: Ernesto C.

description: Three stars for the one and only veggie sandwich they have on the menu. Came in here with coworker after he told me he had one of the best sandwiches of his life from here. So, if you're a meat eater this review is irrelevant. It's a little busy place around lunch time on a weekday, be prepared to maybe wait 15ish minutes for order to be ready. There's a number of tables inside, where people awkwardly gather around, waiting. If you're vegetarian/ vegan, I would consider other options before coming here BUT if you do find yourself here, they do have a veggie sandwich. It's alright, very basic with lettuce, tomorrow, cucumber, avocado, mustard, mayo, cheese. I opted out of the cheese and mayo to make it vegan. They send it through a little oven, not sure why with no meat or cheese, maybe to toast the bread, ok. The staff had the sandwich making system down and were hustling and had good customer service. Can't say I'd come back for a basic sandwich but all was good.
author: Parker S.

description:
Tried this almost on the spur of the moment.

No selection of bread, though they have a good selection of fillings. Competitive pricing.

Okay service. Not sparkling.

Ordered a meatball sandwich. Burnt my bread to a blackened crisp. Meatballs not tasty. Sauce simple unspiced tomato sauce as far as I could tell - it was mostly overpowered by the char.

I'll pass on a revisit, which I'm sure all it's proponents will like since there will be more room for them.
author: R H.

description: My favorite sandwich spot anywhere! Pastrami, turkey and avocado toasted to perfection .. I usually go no sauce (Italian dressing) or light sauce. Order ahead of time to avoid any lines.
author: Jack B.

description: This place is hands down amazing! One disclaimer is lack of parking and limited seating! Besides that I had the atomic which included pastrami and crones beef with turkey! To say the least it was exactly what I was wanting on this blustery day in NorCal. They are quick and very nice. This place is straight forward and reasonably priced. I will definitely go back next time I am in the area;) thanks y'all!
author: Sarah C.

description:
Great sandwiches, great bread, great service and good price!

Pros:
- Picked up a sandwich with a buddy for lunch and was delighted that the bread was so moist and fluffy.
- Ingredients were fresh and the sandwich had the right amount of flavor.
- Portion was great for the price!

Cons:
- Parking was not easy.
author: Peter L.

description: Absolutely Outstanding...I had the atomic I was foolish and got the large.  I was absolutely stuffed I should've stopped eating but it was so good I couldn't stop.
author: Michael S.

description: The sandwiches were very satisfying and the wait time was a decent 10-15 mins with 3 other people. I would definitely come back.
author: Angel N.

description:
I had a chance to reminisce here after almost a decade since my last visit as I had moved to the East Bay and hadn't spent much time in West Portal.  

This is a cherished spot that, in this reporter's humble opinion, would be a San Francisco landmark except for the fact that locals obviously want to keep it hidden.  

In 30 years, the decorum remains iconically traditional as a true "Sub Shop".  It's steps from the West Portal Muni and tastefully decorated with Niners merchandize that is actually "We like the Niners and didn't just pick up from a $10 giveaway night to decorate our store"

Listen...  You're not getting massaged Waygu beef sliders or some turkey massaged by some yoga guru.  You're getting a (*&#$  fantastic sub on perfectly toasted break with a splash of their special sauce that will make you remember your childhood like you were "drinking sodi' pop and playing stickball in the streets while Ms. Johnson yelled from the window".  

Don't change SubCenter.  

Forever loyal to the Greatest
author: Stephen R.

description: I like the concept of this place but my issues with it are that service and it is not the best, and the amount of meat you get in your sandwich for the cost needs to be more if you double the meat on a super, then to me this is an awesome
author: Eric A.

description: Amazing hot pastrami sandwiches. I wish they were closer to my work in San Bruno!
author: Sergey M.

description: Still my favorite sandwich spot to date in the entire Bay Area. They somehow know how to combine the best crunchy on the outside/soft on the inside bread with the best meats around. I hate all the "boar's head" hype. This is so much better with shredded lettuce, perfect amount of soft white onion and dressing. I recommend ordering ahead because it can get crowded. Pastrami is amazing as is the atomic and even just the regular turkey. You won't be disappointed.
author: Danielle H.

description: Not bad, didn't meet my standards at all compared to Pop's Sandwich Shop. Located on 737 Portola
author: Timothy S.

description:
Just want to post a little update: I still come back to this spot even though I don't live in the area anymore.

Damn good sandwiches, impressively fast sandwich making, friendly staff. This place is bomb, never change Sub Center!
author: Casey W.

description:
4.5 stars but rounding up since this is one of the better sandwiches I've had in a while! If you hate waiting, call at least 20 minutes ahead of time to place your to-go order- otherwise, expect to wait a good amount of time if you're going anytime near the lunch rush. We called in   about 15 minutes ahead of time, so our order wasn't ready when we arrived- luckily, I was able to double park right by the Submarine Center and didn't have to deal with the West Portal traffic. We tried:

-S3/Italiano (Mortadella, Capicolla, Salami, Provolone w/Mustard, Mayo, Onions, Lettuce, Tomatoes, Secret Sauce, $7.45/Center/Medium, http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=EnoLVES88d-IqZ7RVMo2Mw&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): Yum- the combination of ingredients worked really well in this sandwich! However, the variety of different meats were a bit too much for me (I preferred the simplicity of the hot pastrami), but this is highly recommended for any cured meat lover.
-S6/Hot Pastrami (w/Mustard, Mayo, Onions, Lettuce, Tomatoes, Secret Sauce, $7.45/Center/Medium, http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Xs0_MOHa4sY1UCRAzVOzIg&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): Yum- this was my favorite sandwich out of the two. The pastrami had excellent flavor, and was seasoned very well. I could only make it through half the sandwich since I didn't want to fall into food coma. Highly recommended!

Overall, we all enjoyed our sandwiches a lot. I've been to my fair share of highly rated delis/sandwich shops, and the sandwiches from Submarine Center is up there with the best. I definitely want to come back to try their BBQ Beef and a Gourmet Sub sandwich (one with avocado), and will make sure I call way ahead of time to avoid any wait. Parking in this area is very difficult since there isn't too much street parking.
author: Amy D.

description:
I just wanna know why I was charged $8.80 for a MINI hot pastrami. The price on the board said $6. With tax, my total shouldve been $6.52. Is it cuz I used a card? But  +$2.28 for using a debit card seems excessive. I asked for a receipt so I could see what the line item charges were but it didn't show. It just said total: $8.80. Perhaps I was mischarged. I still love their sandwiches but this made me really unhappy. 

ONE PIECE OF ADVICE FOR CUSTOMERS: Make sure you compare the price on the board to the price you're charged.
author: Ashley M.

description: I've been going here for fifteen years and this place has never disappointed. The sandwiches are always delicious!! Most recently, I had the veggie, hubby had the corned beef. The lines are out the door and are a little slow because everything is made to order, but they have phone in ordering, so I'd suggest that if you were in a hurry. The shop is tiny with about six cramped tables. We did eat in, but the line of customers is right next to your table so it's not really a have-a-date kind of a place, unless you like your fellow patrons hearing your entire conversation
author: Cynthia T.

description:
3.5 stars. Unfortunately I think the Yelp reviews hyped it up a bit too much for me so I had really high expectations. I ordered the mini pastrami sandwich, which was $6. 

The bread was nicely toasted and the meat + filling were good. I just didn't think there was anything special about it to warrant 4.5 stars. The workers here were quick and friendly. I wouldn't be opposed to coming back if I need a quick bite but it's definitely not the best sandwich I've had.
author: Sophia H.

description:
Honestly - just stop reading this review and go get a sandwich at Submarine Center. 

The only suggestion I have is to go for the 'center' size as it's plenty of food for one person - and I can eat a good bit.
author: Andy G.

description: Great sandwiches! They have had the same staff for so long too!! Anything you order will most likely be fantastic
author: Stephanie D.

description: Best sandwiches I've ever had! I've been coming here for a couple of years now and their secret sauce remains the same. Their bread sizes and meat portions are becoming smaller by the day which really makes it unfortunate.
author: Mabel C.

description: This place is a little hole in the wall. Very close to sf state. Prices are fair and the sandwiches are made fresh. Highly recommended. I ordered the atomic and it was delicious
author: Jon P.

description: The atomic was all that I was told that it was and more.  This was not some fusion hipster dot com garonla BS either.  It was the real deal.
author: George P.

description: Hands down best sandwich in town. I eat here at least twice a month. I highly recommend the turkey Avocado.
author: Erin V.

description: I always get the hot pastrami. So good!! They have plenty of other options that I'm sure are good too. Great for a quick meal!
author: Jessica W.

description: This is clearly the best sandwich place I ever been to, hands down!!! The "atomic sub" is my favorite, it's fresh juicy and certainly tasty!
author: Tesh W.

description: This has been my sandwich place for about 3 years. But lately I have noticed some new employees and I am not too sure about their skills. Have to visit a few more times.
author: Lauren W.

description: Best sandwich shop I've eaten at in San Francisco. Used to eat at the one on 9th and Lincoln at least a couple times a month, either Hot Pastrami, Italian, or Meatball. Gotta get the jalapenos on it!
author: Rob S.

description: It used to be a great little corner restaurant with super fresh and yummy food near my office. It has gone down hill... not sure why.  The tomatoes weren't so fresh. Yucks
author: Bobby D.

description:
ITS ALL ABOUT THE G4!

hot juicy pastrami
creamy avocado
melty swiss cheese
soft & lightly toasted crunchy roll 

Comes standard with crispy lettuce, sliced tomatoes, onions and Submarine's secret sauce. 

Such a simple (no frills and won't fall a part) sandwich but everything is so fresh and well-portioned. Its all about the right meat to veg to sauce to bread ratio for me in a sandwich and Submarine Center has got it right. Can't wait to go back!

Pro-tip: 
- Request to add jalapenos
author: Sue Y.

description:
Two words:

HOT.
PASTRAMI.

This place delivers simple yet extremely delicious deli style sandwiches. I can't vouch for any other sandwich here, as I've gotten the hot pastrami every single time, but whenever I'm in the mood for a filling sub, I head on over to The Center.
author: Justin H.

description: Been coming here for thirty years. Great sandwiches and great value. I always get the turkey.
author: Melissa C.

description:
The best in town.  Nobody does it like this place.  My favorite is the hot pastrami.  

Super small, so I recommend calling in and picking up to go.

Same family has been there for as long as I can remember (at least 15 years, if not 20).

They have fountain sodas!!!
author: M J.

description: Man this sandwiches are the best. No questions asked I live coming here at least once a week. I would go everyday but I just want to make it an eximente to go. Well anyways I definitely recommend this place.
author: Oscar T.

description:
Fresh, crispy, tender pastrami, mouth watering deli sandwiches!!!

I love how fresh the ingredients are, and how when he takes out the hot pastrami it's dripping sauces all over and it looks really juicy. Hold on, LOOOKS juicy? IT WAS SUPER JUICY. The bread was really crispy so it gave the sandwich a nice crunch. Writing this review makes me regret not getting another sandwich togo, haha.

Overall, this place is fantastic. I love how friendly the guys are and the menu description for the hot pastrami says it all, and it says "Delicious"
author: Angela T.

description:
Mannnnnnn I don't even know how to start this review. I have been going to Submarine Center since I was in middle school (I am graduating grad school now) and I remember walking here after school. Yes, since middle school I have been to many other sandwiches places in the city and yes, I do love Ike's. However, Submarine's Center's appeal is not all the wacky combos it comes up with but its simplicity. It's just fresh ingredients, juicy meats, delicious sauce, on perfectly toasted bread. It is to die for. 

I usually get the cheese steak (roast beef with cheese) just because of habit but the pastrami and atomic subs (pastrami and turkey) are really really good. The pastrami is so flavorful. Together with the tomato, lettuce, cheese, mustard, mayonnaise and special sauce (I think it is Italian dressing...) these sandwiches just work. They make the sandwich right when you order and toast the bread, meat, and cheese before putting on the rest of the toppings. This makes the bread so crispy but keeps the lettuces fresh. I have tried the various soups here too and they are quite good. 

I swear almost all the workers here are the same as when I was growing up - which is great. That is probably why this place has remained so consistent all these years. When my sister was pregnant she craved this place; whenever my brother comes back home to visit we go here. The lines have gotten long because of how popular this place has been but you it moves fast and you can also call in your order and they will have it ready for you when you arrive. 

The only problem with Submarine Center is that they offer a mini size. Every time I go and decide I will just get a mini to be good I have SO MUCH REGRET. The mini is gone so fast an then I wish I got a bigger size. T_T Just get the center or super size so that you don't suffer regret.
author: Jocelyn K.

description: Best Italian sandwiched ever! The staff and owners are wonderful people. They are nice and polite but also very busy.
author: Nadia C.

description:
Best sandwiches in San Francisco the service is great too 
Been coming to this sandwich shop since my Jr. High school days owners 
Same too.
Great job thanks !!!
I always get center pastrami with every thing. Awesome!!! 
They have big menu
author: Sergei Z.

description:
It might be small and slightly hidden, but nevertheless a great sandwich place.

1) First Impression
It was Saturday, around 1PM. 
There was a line to order with about 6 people in front of me, but I didn't mind.
Lots of sports memorabilia hanging around all over the walls and time passed by quickly as I was observing the different items on the wall.

The menu was fairly straight forward with specials clearly labeled and I went straight for the S2. Cheese Steak, Super sized, for $9.15. 

2) Wait time
Placing my order took close to 10 minutes, and receiving my order was almost another 10 minutes. Nothing much to do in here while waiting and it is pretty cramped in terms of space. Keep in mind, after ordering, you have to proceed to another line to the right to pick up your order, so you're gonna stuck inside there and it could get a little hot and possibly stuffy. 
I did not know that we had to move to another line, but it did not seem to matter since I heard them call my order out.

3) The Food
The sandwich was absolutely delicious.
They really loaded it up with roast beef and the secret sauce was definitely a plus.
I ordered the super size and definitely felt full after eating it, so it was well worth the $9.
The bread/bun was toasted first in the oven and had a very crunchy feeling, almost like a Vietnamese sandwich. (not necessarily a bad thing)
It didn't fall apart and drop everywhere like most sandwiches do.

Keep in Mind: 
*It was quite loud in here with all the customers and people dining in.
*Not necessarily the best place to dine in: quite cramped and people will be standing right next to you when you're eating which might be a little weird.
*The staff seemed fairly nice and intact, despite having to deal with so many orders all at once.
*Not the store's fault, but there was one rude man who said "Excuse Me" in the most annoyed tone because we didn't move out of the way right after we ordered, even though it was only a few seconds.

*Final Verdict*
These sandwiches are great and I definitely see myself coming back here in the future.
Why have I not heard of this place before?
author: Jeffy Y.

description:
Submarine sandwiches was really shitty sandwiches found a hair in my sandwich the meet was smelling old were bad sanwiches I don't suggest nobody to go eat there that's really bad place for sandwiches there's better places in San Francisco for sandwiches but not this sheath place
It hair in sandwich
author: Edvin Y.

description: Stopped in here for lunch. Wow -- the sandwiches are awesome. Fast service too! Support local businesses like these! You won't be disappointed.
author: Steph L.

description:
Bad service.  I walked in with my son, there were only two people in front of me. I patiently waited to ordered two sandwiches. They put them in the oven to toast and I moved to the end to pay. I stood there and literally watched 5 sandwiches toasted, made and paid for people behind me in line. By the time he took our sandwiches out of the toaster, he couldn't remember my sandwich order. The bread was so overly toasted it crumbled when I ate it. I was so starving at that point I ate it rather than waiting another 20 minutes for a sandwich. 

Guy at the registered apologized but obviously knew I was upset since he saw me standing there forever while all the people in line behind me got their sandwiches. They need to come up with a better system. It's not rocket science, you're just making sandwiches. First and only time I'll go here.
author: Lora M.

description: The best subs I've ever had, bar none! I've been coming here for a very, very long time and they're food is always insanely delicious and fresh. I could eat one of these everyday. I normally get the turkey sub and also their split pea soup is to die for. I love how friendly they are too. They really know how to keep the quality of the food and how to keep us coming back for more.
author: Michi R.

description:
Back in my SFSU college days, after class on special occasions (which meant when I had money to spare) I would take the Muni up to West Portal and enjoy a warm sandwich at this spot. It's where I discovered my love for meatball subs. It's a family run business. Mom and Dad and the mustached, cute sons. They were very quick, and it felt like the kind of place where you didn't want to mess up the rhythm so you better know what you want once you get up there. They were friendly through the process, yet you don't want to be that person slowing the machine. It's been nearly 20 yrs since my first steps into this spot and it's still the same... minus the mustached sons. The place was packed on a Saturday afternoon at 2pm. I starred in awe of the owners how they have remained the same... just with a few greys. The walls are still covered with the same local 49ers memorabilia and some new local additions. The main thing is that the food is still the same... the process, the taste, the small space and the machine is still pumping it out. I love their fresh cut pickles and cucumbers. I love that they heat up all the sandwiches. I love all of their toppings. They are so busy and constantly refilling it so you really don't get a bad piece. They are the reason why I eat veggies with my meatball sub... I couldn't imagine it any other way now. I dream about eating their sub often, I wish I could say that I go often though I don't but I wish I could. All I know is in 20 years I have relocated many times and many of my favorites have closed their doors, so it's great to see a love remain open. 
Till next time.

ps. parking does suck, but suck it up and hunt for a spot... or take the train or bus in.
author: Madhu D.

description:
Delicious hole in the wall. "The Atomic" is bliss if you like jalepenos. This sandwich is loaded with hot pastrami, turkey, corned beef and cheese, plus the usual spread of onions, lettuce, tomato, and their secret sauce (plus mayo/mustard if that's your thing).

The mini is enough food for me, but they also offer larger sizes. There is also a long list of meatball subs and gourmet (aka comes with a full avocado) subs that they offer. Great place to pick up sandwiches on the way to the beach.
author: Drew M.

description: That man is extremely stubborn. I tried to make a change that would've been no extra cost to them. I simply tried to change my Swiss cheese to cucumbers, and that was going to cost me extra money. Even though it's already an item included with other sandwiches
author: Adam O.

description: Hands down one of the best subs in the city! Always consistent and friendly staff. And I love that they give you 3 lengths for your sub--makes it more customizable. Def recommend the hot pastrami!
author: Kristine N.

description: BEST SANDWICH I HAVE EVER HAD (No exaggeration) My boyfriend, who is a SF native, brought me to this place on one of our first dates, and holy smokes. The hot pastrami is the best pastrami sandwich that probably exists anywhere. I know this sounds hyperbolic, but I'm serious when I say this place has always been next level, the guys who work there are so nice, and it is an institution. Treat yourself to a center cut hot pastrami, with everything on it. You won't regret it.
author: Julie A.

description: Wow, Can you overtoast my sandwich more please? Thanks for making my lunch terrible. I had to toss it in the trash.
author: Jane S.

description:
This little gem I found in high school turned out to be hands down my favorite sub place. It's convenient, quick, and cheap!

My usual is the hot pastrami sub, which is basically what it sounds like. First of all, their bread is toasted to perfection, forming a light brown shell around the sub with the nicest crunch every time you take a bite. And if that's not enough for you, the inside takes you to a whole nother world! Tender, juicy pastrami stacked inside with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, all topped with their secret sauce. 

I go to college in socal and this place is a MUST whenever I come back to visit home.
author: Ryan C.

description:
In high school there was a neighborhood deli around the corner where I used to go get my lunch sandwich from.  Delicious.  Cheap.  Fast.

Never thought I'd find another neighborhood place like the days of yore until I stumbled upon here whilst waiting for the K at West Portal.  All the memories of my high school deli place resurfaced.

This wasn't just pure nostalgia.  Dare I say, this place surpassed my former stomping grounds.  I get all the ingredients I love on toasted bread served with a smile.  Feels like a homecoming any time I get a chance to eat here.  Five stars.
author: Ghizal A.

description: I have been coming to this same submarine shop in West Portal since I was 12 years old. A lot of the same people still work here! The menu has changed a little but it still top notch. My old standby is a hot pastrami with pepper jack cheese, jalapeños, lettuce, tomatoes, mustard, mayo, their special sauce, and of course TOASTED! The bread is what makes the sandwich so fantastic. Crunchy on the outside and slightly softer on the inside.  Seating is limited during rush hour so come off peak if you want to linger and flip through the sporting green.
author: Chad H.

description: We used to live in the neighborhood and now we miss this place so much!  Every chance I get, I get a hot pastrami to go. Jalapeños please!
author: Tina C.

description: I've been coming here since middle school so that's been a long time. When I first started coming here I thought I was just a little place but then I got to know the people and the staff and the owner and they are super nice super cool people but what drew me to keep coming back was I got to see the people that make my sandwich that's one of my pet peeves I only eat at taquerias and sandwich places where I can actually see them make my food so I could say that's too much or can you please add a little more and just little things like if I see something drop and then put it back on my sandwich thank got that never happened but I don't know it's just one of my things. This place is very little very tiny but very cozy and they make you feel like home. My favorite is the Atomic Submarine and the Italiano. I always get the mini and it always feels me up.
author: Michele T.

description: Second time coming here and ordered the Hot Pastrami. Lady in front got her sandwich but then I was caught between two large to go orders, which seemed inefficient. When I saw the guy come out with the sandwich from the oven it had cheese on it, even though I didn't ask for it. I am lactose intolerant and I told the guy and he just removed most of the cheesy pastrami pieces and put new ones on. If you are allergic to dairy please do take note. Somewhat dissatisfied with the experience, it wasn't very pleasing biting into an overly toasted bread that just crumbled everywhere making the sandwich quite dry. It used to be good from memory. Won't be going back.
author: Marc W.

description:
Sub Center has been my favorite sandwich place since I was a kid. I take all of my out-of-town guests here and they're blown away. The Atomic is a huge winner even though I prefer the turkey. 

A pro-tip is to always call in your order and skip both the line to order and the line to pay. Most people don't realize if they've called ahead, it's possible to walk past everyone else and go pay.

Parking can be rough in West Portal, so try to have a passenger who can jump out and get your food.
author: Stefan M.

description: Has gone downhill and raised their prices at that. Go to Genes liquor on Taraval. Same sandwich menu but cheaper and better. Sad this has gone downhill.
author: Felicia H.

description: Be sure to be very specific in instructions when ordering online. If you don't ask for mustard and mayo, you will get it anyway unless you specify in the instructions.  Very excellent sandwiches. They are not stingy on the meats or cheese. Subway should take not of this place. Similar to Quiznos but better. Be ready for long lines which demoralize you when you are hungry but if you timed it, they really do go quick.
author: Luis R.

description: TBH I think Gene makes a better sub. His sauce? Delicious? His bread? Graziano!!  The subs?? Bellamisiano!! Sometimes my stepdad won't let me get genes after school and I get so mad that I kick fucking holes in the wall.
author: Max F.

description:
The subs here, and the Roxie Food Center, are the best subs in San Francisco; I teeter, back and forth, as to which is the best.

As with any great sub, fresh, crispy bread is required. Always get it toasted, and spring for the pickles (they cost extra). Skip the vinaigrette though; it throws off the balance of flavors.
author: Dimitri S.

description: Best pastrami sandwich I ever had! Every Sandwich are toasted to perfection. I have been coming here for years, lines are always out the door during lunch time but well worth it! Order ahead of time is the best option if you don't want to hurry up and wait.
author: Hubert C.

description:
When you treat your food like artistry, you get submarine. This place has taken so much of my money and I'm happy to give it to them in return for what I call a perfect sandwich.these guys understand what it means to build a proper sandwich. Over ten years as a customer  and I have never been disappointed.

From 5 to 3.
Won't be be back here for awhile because a worker (short guy with glasses) literally disregarded the fact he left the bread in the oven too long because he forgot about it and proceeded to serve the bread even though it was board line burnt. Im not even complaining that he completed two customers order before mine when they were after me. I get it, it happens. The problem is the bread was so crunchy that it just ruined the whole sandwich. You can literraly almost cut your mouth eat that thing. I didn't say anything to see if he would actually have the decency to toast another one given that fact this place prides itself in making quality sandwiches.. NOPE. He clearly sees that it was over toasted but I guess I was expecting to much from him. I know this place gets a lot of business, but you know nothing last forever especially when your staff starts  not caring about the quality.  The difference is night and day when the owner makes the sandwiches. You can tell he still makes every sandwich perfectly, from the timing to the layers and amount if each ingredient that goes in. It so good! And the bald guy is good too. I've been going here for at least 3 times a month for the past few months for whatever reason, but I guess you can say the last sandwich left a bad taste in my mouth. 

All in all. I'll be back.... just not for a long long time.  You can think the short guy with glasses for that. Hopefully next time he gives a damn.
author: Herb L.

description:
This place use to have the best sandwiches with rare real roast beef. 

Came by here recently and found the rare roast beef is no longer served here.

Now the beef is slices of what seems to be deli meat, which is rubbery. My only reason to come here is now, no longer available. Goodbye.
author: Thomas N.

description:
I love watching the guys behind the counter work their magic during the lunch hour rushes! They are incredibly talented at their crafts and definitely got their systems down. 

Hands down, still one of the best places to get your hot pastrami sandwiches. The Atomic sub with corn beef, pastrami, and turkey is delicious as well! 

Prices are cheap, less than $9 for the regular sized Atomic with everything.
author: Ellen W.

description: Friendly staff, best sandwiches in SF because of their secret sauce. My go-to is the Turkey Sub!
author: Christina G.

description:
Been going here ever since I learned how to walk.  We used to grab these sandwiches just right before a movie at "the Empire" theater.

They still make the sandwiches the same old way and the magnificent "secret vinegar dressing" is to die for. (I can probably drink a gallon in one setting.)

IMHO - I only go for the "Hot" sandwiches baked in the "Salamander Pizza Oven."  The breads are fresh and the ingredients are fantastic as you can create your own sandwich.

My "All Time Favorite" has to be the "Italiano" with extra dressing.  Grab a bag of Maui Onion chips and cold Snapple - Dolce Vita.  Don't go during rush hour or on a sunny day because there are limited tables there.

Great things/places should always remain the same...  This is an San Francisco Landmark!
author: R8 T.

description: I've been going here regularly for 5 years with no plan to stop anytime soon. I searched this city high and low for years (!) for a go-to sub shop, and finally found it right here in West Portal. But I'm gong to be honest, it's a little bit soup nazi in here, although the sandwiches are well worth it.  And the soup, too. Your best bet is to order ahead thru yelp and minimize the need for interactions once you're there. Everyone involved benefits from this approach. Happy sandwiching!
author: Natalie N.
